constituent: age, teeth, tooth, stop, footprint, rice, shovel, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko
heisigStory: This character is used to express the years of one's age. Its elements: teeth . . . orders.
koohiiStory1: You know you are fast approaching a ripe old AGE when you get ORDERS from the dentist to get new TEETH.
koohiiStory2: This has the nuance of a life milestone. Here it's represented by the life-cycle of teeth: In childhood, your teeth give the orders, growing whenever they want. As a teenager, we give orders to the teeth, by putting braces on them. In old age, we order new teeth!
